item.title: Kadena Shuts Down – How a 77% Crash and Cash Burn Ended One of Crypto’s Most Ambitious Projects
item.description:
Kadena has announced a shutdown after running out of funds, though the proof-of-work chain has kept operating. KDA has fallen 77% in a month and over 99% from its 2021 high as exchanges have begun delisting. The team has planned a new binary and a community handover.

The post Kadena Shuts Down – How a 77% Crash and Cash Burn Ended One of Crypto’s Most Ambitious Projects appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Oracle OCI Compute E6 Benchmarks For Leading AMD EPYC Turin Performance In The Cloud
item.description: Oracle recently launched their E6 compute shape for Oracle Cloud and powered by AMD EPYC 9005 "Turin" processors. Oracle Cloud Infrastructure also launched their Compute Cloud@Customer X11 and Private Cloud Appliance X11 platforms that are all powered by the E6 compute shape with 5th Gen AMD EPYC. For those curious about the performance and value of the Oracle Cloud E6 shape compared to prior-gen E5 as well as alternatives from Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud, these benchmarks are geared for you.

item.title: Over 250 Magento Stores Hit Overnight as Hackers Exploit New Adobe Commerce Flaw
item.description:

The vulnerability in question is CVE-2025-54236 (CVSS score: 9.1), a critical improper input validation flaw that could be

item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Wednesday added a critical security flaw impacting Motex Lanscope Endpoint Manager to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, stating it has been actively exploited in the wild.
